channel.title: Dodian Error
channel.description:
[code]NPCHandler.java:8: illegal forward reference int Player = npcs[NPCID].getKiller(); ^ NPCHandler.java:8: cannot find symbol symbol : variable NPCID location: class NPCHandler int Player = npcs[NPCID].getKiller(); ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Please help you getz meh cooookieee

item.title: Dodian Error
item.dc:creator: @vic_08 Vic_
item.description:
@vic_08 wrote:

The code is correct… I have a devo source, I’ll show you mine…

} int Player = npcs[NPCID].getKiller();

See they match. I think your getKiller() process is incorrect. You might want to double check it…

item.title: Dodian Error
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

[quote=“trytohaxme, post:3, topic:234971”]This is the first 10 lines.

[code]import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;

public class NPCHandler {

int Player = npcs[NPCID].getKiller();
public static Player p = null; 
public int maxNPCs = 10000;
public static boolean IsDropping = false;
public static int maxListedNPCs = 10000; // npc list every npc listed no

[/code][/quote]

I think the

int Player = npcs[NPCID].getKiller();

Would go into your public boolean AttackPlayer.

–

vic 08:

Lel? You’re truly a moron.

You just happen to be the only retard that quoted me before I had modified my post.

Read full topic
